events.name: Next '19 Extended Cincinnati
events.description:
Please join us for this exciting opportunity! Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ’19 experience.

At the InfoTrust office, in Blue Ash/Cincinnati we will be take part in official Google Training (a $55+ value) free of charge.

** Updated **

We have set our agenda. Looking forward to bringing together the community! Do not forget to bring your computers. Food and drinks will be provided. There is plenty of room for parking.

5:30 - Networking: Enjoy some food and good company
6:00 - Streaming of a Google Next 19 event
7:00 - Quest - A 2-hour Code Study Jam
-- Topic "App Dev: Setting up a Development Environment - Python"
-- Topic "App Dev: Storing Application Data in Cloud Datastore - Python"
9:00 - Discussion about GDG group, how we are using cloud technologies, and wrap up
events.how_to_find_us: InfoTrust office is Suite 200, we are directly across the street from Summit Park.

events.name: Baseline - Beginner Quest for Big Data, ML and AI
events.description:
Join us for a quest to take on the hot topics of machine learning, big data, and AI! With Google-provided material, we will go through the quest as a group, hopefully walking away having learned more about this fast-growing space.

All experience levels and backgrounds welcome!

** Food and Drink provided **

Agenda:
5:30-6 PM ET: Networking and hanging out with other Cloud enthusiasts
6-8 PM: Quest: GCP Qwik Labs
8-?

Bring your computer to follow along.

About the Qwik Lab:
Big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence are today’s hot computing topics, but these fields are quite specialized and introductory material is hard to come by. Fortunately, GCP provides user-friendly services in these areas, and Qwiklabs has you covered with this introductory-level quest, so you can take your first steps with tools like BigQuery, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine.

Watch this video to learn more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjcEBbmJWEw&list=PLIivdWyY5sqJzYuQP321flIkKywBOQCSY&index=1

This is meetup will be held at the InfoTrust office in Blue Ash, Ohio.

Have questions? Reach out to Michael Stadtmiller or Lisa Wilms. Also, feel free to let them know if you have any dietary restrictions they should take into account when ordering food.

events.name: GDG Cloud Cincinnati - Machine Learning API
events.description:
In this month’s meetup, we're talking APIs!

All backgrounds and technical knowledge levels are welcome, but it is suggested that you have some baseline knowledge of Google Cloud.

During this meeting, we will discuss machine learning APIs and work through a lab together. The lab, provided by Google, is free of cost: https://www.qwiklabs.com/focuses/1843?parent=catalog

Agenda:
5:30 - 6 p.m. ET: Meet and Greet, food and drinks provided
6 - 6:30: Introduction from Trish Dhotkar on machine learning APIs and how they can be used as a tool, followed by a discussion on different types of API services
6:30 - 8:00: QUEST! Qwiklabs: Entity and Sentiment Analysis with the Natural Language API followed by a deep dive into some of the applications of this API (product launch reviews)

About the Moderator:
Trisha Dhotkar will be leading the session on APIs. She is a graduate of Rutgers University, with a Master's in IT and Analytics. She is passionate about making data accessible and easy to digest, and has been spending both her work and free time mastering new cloud technologies. Currently, Trisha is a Digital Analytics Engineer at InfoTrust.

events.name: GDG Cloud Cincinnati: Using AutoML to Quantify Emotion
events.description:
GDG Cloud Cincinnati is happy to welcome Scott to discuss his topic on how to use AutoML to Quantify Emotion.

Agenda:
5:30 - 6pm: Networking - FREE FOOD AND DRINK PROVIDED
6 - 7:30 pm: Scott Strawser presentation
7:30 - 8:00: Open Forum - let's see where the topic takes us

Scott Strawser, an emotion AI hobbyist, will be demonstrating his emotion AI machine learning model powered by Google’s AutoML. Scott started exploring unique patterns in emotional data several years ago, and last year, developed an affective computing machine learning model using Google’s AutoML that he submits outperforms emotional analysis products by Microsoft, Amazon, Google and IBM’s Tone Analyzer. He is now seeking solutions to help children with cognitive and social disorders using the model’s REST API and local application developers.

Outline of Presentation
v Experts Can't Agree - Emotion Theories are a Dime a Dozen
v The 4 Core Emotion System (4CES) - A Model of Emotion for Machine Learning
v Google AutoML – A Powerful Tool for Quick ML Modeling
v Comparing Emotion/Sentiment Analysis offered by Major Companies (Google, AWS, Amazon, IBM)
v IBM Watson's Tone Analyzer Vs AutoML 4CES Model – Using IBM’s Own Demo Examples
v IBM Watson's Tone Analyzer Vs AutoML 4CES Model - Using Real World Examples
v Use Cases - The Emotion AI market - Exploring Emotion AI Applications You Can Build
v Live Demo of the 4CES AutoML Model
v How to Access the REST API for Application Development

Location: InfoTrust - 4340 Glendale Milford, Suite #200, Blue Ash, OH 45242

events.name: Happy Hour(s) - Meet^, Drink^, Level^ with GDG Cloud Cincinnati and WAW
events.description:
As 2019 nears a close, it's time to level up our networking! Join us for happy hour as we combine two Meetups, GDG Cloud Cincinnati and Web Analytics Wednesday. Relax, sit back, and meet more awesome people like you: developers, cloud enthusiasts, data scientists, analysts, marketing folks, and others simply interested in or who work with technology.

Fretboard is located in Blue Ash. Although it does have a great drink list, we also welcome people that are not drinkers. We felt this space was a nice change of pace from our sponsor’s office, and will allow people to move around, chat, play cornhole, giant jenga, and maybe even enjoy Fretboard's loaded buffalo chicken fries (YUM!).
We are still obtaining sponsorship for drinks and food, and will update everyone as soon as we know who the sponsor(s) is.

Note: All people welcome over the age of 21. We encourage people from all backgrounds, technical aptitude, seniority, sexual orientation, gender identity, races, and more. We will not tolerate any activity that will discourage the welcome-ness we hope to extend.

events.name: Exploring How Firebase Auth Can Save You Dev Time and Reduce Operational Anxiety
events.description:
Does your app or site have users? Do they ever forget how to login to your app or site? Do you wake up with a little bit of anxiety wondering if you've correctly secured their credentials and content? Do you have an iOS app that also now needs to also support Apple ID? Do you need to let users sign in with their phone number?

If you answered 'yes' to any of these questions, come and learn what Firebase Authentication offers, how it integrates with the other Firebase and Google Cloud Platform solutions, and dive into a handful of problem-solution based 'recipes' and how you can use it for your next

**Please join the GDG Cloud Cincinnati and GDG Cincinnati Groups in welcoming special speaker, Patrick Hammond to discuss this exciting topic! ***

Agenda:
5:30 - 6:00 Networking: Food, refreshments and space provided by our sponsor, InfoTrust

6:00 - Kick off presentation with Patrick, "Exploring How Firebase Authentication Can Save You Development Time and Reduce Operational Anxiety"

7:00 - Hang out and continued discussion

The Speaker:
Patrick Hammond is the CTO at Atomic Robot, co-organizer of GDG Cincinnati and Ohio DevFest, and after 15 years building software is increasingly paranoid anytime he needs to authenticate with a new system.

events.name: VIRTUAL: Intro to AI: Lessons learned from Customer Engineer at Google
events.description:
UPDATED: This meeting has been moved to be a virtual event. Please join us on Google Hangouts Meet at https://meet.google.com/oyn-ukbr-dnn

GDG Cloud Cincinnati's month presentation: An Introduction to AI.

Our Speaker: Andy Lawrences is a Customer Engineer for Google, based in Cincinnati, OH. He previously worked at The Kroger Company, first as a tech lead, and then as part of the enterprise cloud team, where he spent a lot of time with both GCP and Azure. Generally, he has a background as a software developer, architect, and "operations guy" across a variety of industries: Healthcare, Insurance, and Retail.

Beyond the clouds, you'll find him trying to keep up with his family of six. He's always very busy flying RC planes, riding horses, working with Scouts BSA, or playing/watching baseball (go Reds!).

The agenda:
-- 5:30 - 6:00 pm - Networking and intros online
-- 6:00 - 7:00 pm - Andy will go thru an intro to AI, discuss some common challenges and solutions, and briefly touch on the helpful prebuilt Google APIs to help you get started
-- 7:00 - 7:30 pm - Open discussion and more networking

*** GDG Cloud Cincinnati prides itself in being an open and inclusive environment, where people from all walks of life, backgrounds, and technical knowledge are encouraged to come and learn together.***

If you have any questions, please reach out to our organizers.
events.how_to_find_us: DO NOT GO TO INFOTRUST - the office has been closed. Unfortunately meetup does not let you replace address with virtual link. Go here: https://meet.google.com/oyn-ukbr-dnn
